index2ans.A: to enliven paintings through the use of scientific theories about color and optic function
index2ans.B: to bring Classical structure to the Impressionists' approach to painting
index2ans.C: to use color to generate a strong emotional response from the viewer
index2ans.D: to produce an idiosyncratic style characterized by the use of small dots of color

response: The goal of George Seurat's 'Divisionist' paintings, including his famous work "A Sunday on La Grande Jatte," was to use small dots of color to create a unique and idiosyncratic style. This approach allowed him to enliven his paintings and generate a strong emotional response from the viewer, as well as to bring a new level of precision and attention to detail to the world of art. While Seurat was certainly interested in scientific theories about color and optic function, his primary focus was on creating a distinctive and innovative style that would set his work apart from that of his contemporaries.

(C) By creating a presentation and developing the design into a publishable format that addresses all evaluation criteria. 

Designers typically use a variety of methods and techniques to resolve a design, including sketching multiple design ideas, conducting user testing, refining typography and layout, and creating a presentation and developing the design into a publishable format that addresses all evaluation criteria.
